content: MOSCOW, May 4 (Reuters) - Kazakhstan Railways will ban transportation of oil products to the Russian Black Sea port of Taman starting from May 8, according to a document from the state-owned railway operator, seen by Reuters on Thursday.

No reasons for the ban were disclosed in the document, which was issued to cargo shippers.Russian Railways has also restricted rail deliveries to Taman starting from Wednesday this week until further notice after Russian officials said a fuel depot had caught fire near a crucial bridge linking mainland Russia to Crimea. (Reporting by Reuters; Editing by Susan Fenton)
